contentrichtext.text: [[File:The_town_of_khiam_2013-04-06_21-12.jpeg|thumbnail|The town of khiam ]] ''''''Khiam'''''' ([[Arabic language|Arabic]] الخيام; sometimes spelled '''Khiyam''') is a town located in [[South Lebanon Governorate]], near the city of [[Nabatieh]]. It is located in [[Southern Lebanon]], 800 meters above sea level, 120 km away from [[Beirut]] and roughly four kilometers from the Israel border. The town was the scene of a major confrontation between the [[Israeli Army]] and [[Hezbollah]] fighters during the [[2006 Israeli-Lebanese conflict]]. It is most known for the prison [[Khiam Detention Center]] which was operated by the [[South Lebanon Army]] and the [[Israelis]] during the [[Israeli occupation of Lebanon]], and as the site of [[Attacks on United Nations personnel during the 2006 Israel-Lebanon conflict|United Nations post]] which was bombed by the Israeli Army during the 2006 conflict. 4 United Nations military observers were killed in this attack by Israel. {{coord|33|19|37.80|N|35|36|39.96|E|type:city_region:LB_source:dewiki|display=title}} == References == {{reflist|2}} == External links == * [http://www.khiyam.com Khiam Official website] * [http://www.khiamcenter.org Khiam center] * [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/5276618.stm In focus: Al-Khiyam], BBC profile [[Category:Populated places in Lebanon]] {{Lebanon-geo-stub}}
